title: Hardware giant Bunnings buys Adelaide Tools
text:
The business is family-owned by Marissa and Rob Peach. It was originally established in 1949 by Sam Dontas, Marissa's father.

Mr Peach said Adelaide Tools had 50 staff across its five retail outlets, the Oaklands Mower Centre and an online operation with about 8,000 products in its range.

Adelaide Crows great Mark Ricciuto. Angela Milne

Adelaide Tools uses former Adelaide Crows Australian Football League star Mark Ricciuto in its advertising, and has a marketing slogan of "We sell tools, not toys''.

The purchase price was not disclosed.

Bunnings, owned by ASX-listed Wesfarmers, has an estimated market share of close to 50 per cent of the Do-It-Yourself hardware market in Australia, and has been increasingly chasing more growth in supplying trades people.

The power tool market aimed at professional tradies has been growing strongly, with a number of specialist players eyeing expansion.

Sydney Tools, a family-owned power and hand tools retailer operated by the Bey family, has been generating growth of more than 10 per cent a year despite the downturn in the housing and construction sectors.

Advertisement

The product range includes Festool circular saws, Gensafe generators and Metabo jigsaws, with serious tradies wanting hard-wearing premium equipment rather than the cheaper brands such as Ryobi and Ozito.

The Bey family, which opened its first Sydney Tools store in 2001 after 10 years running a power tool repair business, has plans to double its eastern seaboard footprint and expand into new states including Tasmania, South Australia and Western Australia.

Sydney Tools plans to open another 20 stores within two years, from its current network of around 30 stores.

Another specialist power tool retailer on the expansion trail is Gold Coast-based TradeTools, which has several new store openings in the pipeline in Queensland to add to its 18-strong network.
description: Hardware giant Bunnings has acquired the Adelaide Tools retailing chain from its family owners as it expands into the fast-growing specialist tools segment.
